attributes.action: Reinstate the NHS bursary funds for prospective 2017/2018 Nursing students.
attributes.background: The reason for this petition is that government claim there's shortage of nurses in the UK and yet they went ahead to stop the bursary that has been helpful for Nursing students to pay for their tuition fees .Government should reinstate the NHS  bursary funds to encouraging more people into nursing.

attributes.action: Make 8 weeks scans routine during pregnancy in addition to 12 & 20 weeks.
attributes.background: We experienced a missed miscarriage that wasn't picked up until our routine 12 weeks scan. Our baby had stopped developing 2 months previous at 5 weeks. Because the pregnancy had gone on so long I had to have surgical management which required a general anaesthetic and a overnight stay in hospital.
attributes.additional_details: Other developed countries offer routine scans at 8 weeks to pick up any concerns as early as possible. Why don't we have this in the UK? Recent studies show 45% of women who have had a miscarriage show signs of PTSD. When 20-25% of pregnancies end in miscarriage and up to 75% are in 1st trimester, earlier precautions should be essential. Because our pregnancy was so advanced I had to have a surgical miscarriage under general anaesthetic. The US and Australia offer 8 week scans and so should we.

attributes.action: Relevant services must come together to prevent lives lost in open water yearly.
attributes.background: One 2011 July day my son Dylan went swimming at a local quarry; 20 minutes in he got into difficulty, unable to swim the short distance to safety. He reportedly died from cold water shock which has 4 stages; probably in the last stage when everything that has fought to stay alive relaxes.
attributes.additional_details: A minute earlier Dylan's rescuer could have saved his life. Currently the UK has nothing in place to prevent these needless deaths. Schools don't educate about the dangers in & around open water & there is no funding in place for prevention. Since Dylan died there has been another 2000 water related deaths. I want Dylan’s death to serve a purpose rather than for him to have died in vain. I want people to live because Dylan died.  We need change and we need it  now!

attributes.action: Put the British army on our side of the Euro tunnel.
attributes.background: On the news today I saw a report by the BBC saying that there are people calling for the french army on the other side of the Euro tunnel. During the E.U referendum the french had threatened Britain with military action and now we voted out its convenient that only now they consider it.
attributes.additional_details: I think this is dangerous and suspect at best. And with a strong invasion buy Islamic extremist taking place in french politic's is safe to say that we do not know the full extent of the possible danger. There for until we know where we stand after Article 50 has been used i feel it is in the best interest or the British people to have security messures this side of the euro tunnel to protect us from a very probable Trojan horse attack. this offers safety and the ability to fill the tunnel if so

attributes.action: Fight for funding for an effective coastal defence scheme
attributes.background: The surge of December 2013 resulted in devastation and suffering for all the communities of Walcott, Bacton & Happisburgh. Many losses were catastrophic.Walcott and Bacton have been flooded twice, now, in seven years.
attributes.additional_details: Norman Lamb MP has been an ardent campaigner, supporting us and as a result of his support we achieved partial rock armouring at Ostend, Walcott. Following a meeting with him on Tuesday 30th August 2016, he has asked that I urge everyone in the communities whether you are a resident, a regular visitor, a business or holiday home owner to please sign this petition. The more evidential support we can show the government the better it will be for us all in securing extra funding towards a beneficial defence scheme.

attributes.action: Allow Scotland's emergency services to be VAT exempt just like others in the UK
attributes.background: The UK Government has refused to allow Scotland's newly formed Emergency services to be tax exempt which is the case for the rest of the UK's Emergency services. This is wrong and unjust a d needs to end immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
Millions are wasted by Police Scotland being unable to claim back VAT as other Police and fire services do.
It's completely illogical and unjust that Scotland should be forced to pay VAT without being able to reclaim it.

attributes.action: We want RM stonehouse to be kept open it's the  spiritual home and HQ for RM
attributes.background: The government  recently announced that Stonehouse was being put up for sale. Stonehouse is the spiritual embodiment of the Royal Marines  and three commando Brigade is the Royal marines home  and shouldn't be sold for housing it is a listed building that has a lots of heart and history.
attributes.additional_details:
The earliest parts of Stonehouse Barracks date from 1756 The buildings immediately became the headquarters of the Plymouth Division of the Royal Marines. Although the divisional structure of the Royal Marines was dismantled during the Second World War, the barracks remain in use as headquarters of 3 Commando Brigade. 
It is also home to the globe theatre a beautiful music hall. 
As a whole, Stonehouse is described as "the oldest and most important group of barracks in England not forming part of a fortification, a very rare example of C18 planning, and a complex of great historic value

attributes.action: Reinstate tax credits for those who have claims stopped by concentrix.
attributes.background: As many are aware, concentrix have cancelled many people's claims for tax credits forcing many people to live under there means, for weeks and sometimes even months. This is disgusting & needs to be fixed ASAP. We need money to survive.

attributes.action: All NHS trusts to offer a minimum of 2 funded fertility treatments.
attributes.background:
We have been struggling with infertilty for the last 6 years, we have had various drugs and one Funded IVF cycle.
We got pregnant with IVF. Our baby boy was born pre-term (18wks) and didn't survive. 
This petition is to help others in a similar circumstance to us, to have another NHS funded cycle.
attributes.additional_details: Not all NHS trusts offer the same amount funded cycles.

attributes.action: Save Oswestry Maternity Unit
attributes.background: Oswestry MLU it is in danger of becoming a birthing unit. Add your voice to this petition to keep this unit open full time & keep this amazing service,  vital not only for births in Shropshire & Powys but to keep the amazing ante & post natal care so many of us have been lucky enough to receive.
attributes.additional_details:
Taken from The Shropshire Star:

Fears have been raised because no details have been announced about how rural maternity services such as those at Ludlow, Bridgnorth and Oswestry are to be funded beyond April 2017 when the current funding contract ends.

Shrewsbury and Telford Hospitals NHS Trust, which runs the Ludlow midwife-led unit, insists there are no plans to close it permanently.

However the financial recovery plan for the trust lists one of the possible changes as converting three midwife led units to birthing centres.


Read more at http://www.shropshirestar.com/news/health/2016/12/12/call-for-clarity-over-shropshires-rural-maternity-units/#708l6fDDyjgG1DFp.99

attributes.action: To teach UK pupils how food choices impact the environment
attributes.background:
No other single activity has a bigger impact on the planet than the raising of livestock for meat, milk and eggs.

By adding to the school curriculum we can introduce positive environmental change by educating pupils of how their buying behaviour and food choices effect the world we live in.
attributes.additional_details: http://science.time.com/2013/12/16/the-triple-whopper-environmental-impact-of-global-meat-production/

attributes.action: Reverse the unfair changes to the State Pension Age imposed on 1950's women.
attributes.background: Thousands of women born in the 1950's expected to receive their State Pension when they reached 60 and planned accordingly. The speed at which the SP changes were introduced and for many with little or no notice has deprived them of their rightful pension. Our SP was earned - it is not a benefit.

attributes.action: For Parliament to ban the non-stun slaughter of animals in the UK.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom has a proud and admirable record in animal welfare.  When the RSPCA's forebearer came into existence in 1824, it was the first such body of its kind.  It is shameful that almost two centuries later we still permit the inhumane slaughter of animals based on religious grounds.
attributes.additional_details:
Both the RSPCA and the BVA are firmly of the view that animals who are not stunned before slaughter suffer.

The view of the previous Government was completely unsatisfactory and ignored widely accepted scientific evidence.  Additionally, the University of Bristol has released research indicating that many Islamic scholars agree stunned meat can remain Halal.

Regardless, it is time the United Kingdom joined Norway, Iceland, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Denmark, and Sweden in an outright ban.

attributes.action: Ban disposable plastic crockery and cutlery to help the environment
attributes.background: Recently France became the first country to pass an all-out ban on plastic cutlery, plates, and cups. Let's follow their example through a ban on disposable plastic tableware. These plastics affect our environment and use fossil fuels. Plastic pollution is a pervasive issue but we can change this.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastics are extremely durable, lightweight, cheap and versatile - features which mean that they have replaced many traditional materials such as metal, glass and wood. Unfortunately these features make them the most pervasive, persistent and hazardous form of litter in our environment. 

Furthermore, plastic manufacturing is estimated to use 8 percent of yearly global oil production. This precious resource is being wasted on disposable products for 'convenience'. This is not sustainable.

attributes.action: SEN Support for children without EHCPs should be as legally binding.
attributes.background: If a child has an EHCP the local authority and school and legally obliged and have a duty of care to ensure their needs are met. If a child is on SEN support but does not have an EHCP, legally the schools do not have the same obligations and so children are being let down and left unsupported.
attributes.additional_details: We would like to see this loophole being closed and ensure regardless of whether a child has an EHCP or not children who are offered SEN support are still being provided with the same opportunities and rights as a child with an EHCP. There are examples which can be provided of children who have SEN support without an EHCP who have had professional outside agencies visit the school and offer recommendations but the schools have ignored these and not put them into practice. We feel this is unfair.

attributes.action: Have an independent investigation into BBC Impartiality & Neutrality
attributes.background: The BBC Claims to be neutral and impartial. The Left claim it is very right-wing, the Right claim it is very left-wing. BBC Reluctant to investigate itself and is arrogant when suggested that it is not impartial.
attributes.additional_details: The BBC seem reluctant to investigate themselves, and they appear arrogant when suggested that they are not impartial. But some went to the same schools and universities as politicians they may be involved with, or even members of the same clubs. This is why the investigation needs to be by somebody who would not let this influence them.

attributes.action: Support Demilitration, Unification and Right of Self Determination for Kashmiris
attributes.background: Citizens of Jammu Kashmir were promised Right of Self Determination under UN Resolution of 13th August 1948 accepted by both India and Pakistan and supported by International Community including UK, with passage of time UK  changed stance to bilateral & territorial issue between both occupiers of JK
attributes.additional_details:
1)Jammu Kashmir was autonomous while India was ruled by British. On the 15th August 1947 British Rule came to an End. JK Maharaja was undecided about the future of JK. On 22nd & 27th October 1947 respectively, JK was invaded by Pakistan and India subsequently resulting in Bloodshed & Division of Jammu Kashmir. 

2)Late Lord Mountbatten who was first Governor General of India, accepted in a document in 1947 that the final settlement of Jammu Kashmir can only be determined by Citizens of Kashmir

attributes.action: Make it illegal to harass a learner driver who is on a lesson.
attributes.background: It is becoming more and more dangerous for driving instructors to teach learners on UK roads as we are continually harassed by other, so called "qualified" drivers. We are cut up, sworn at, threatened and verbally abused every day. This should be treated as a "hate crime".
attributes.additional_details: I have been overtaken on many occasions while approaching a pedestrian crossing or road junction in a dangerous manner. Sooner or late, (probably sooner), this will lead to a death or serious accident involving an innocent member of the public. There are many examples on various websites to support this.

attributes.action: UK Government Should intervene to stop Rohingya genocide in Burma
attributes.background: Scores of Rohingya Muslims are fleeing to Bangladesh because of a military crackdown in western Myanmar, according to residents and Bangladeshi army officials.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the Rohingya were shot as they tried to cross the Naaf River that separates Myanmar and Bangladesh, while others arriving by boat were pushed away by Bangladeshi border guards, residents quoted by Reuters news agency said on Wednesday.



A total of 130 people have been killed in the latest surge of violence in the country, according to the Myanmar army.
The bloodshed is the most serious since thousands were killed in communal clashes in the western Myanmar state of Rakhine since 2012.

attributes.action: Stop sales of arms to Saudi Arabia until there are no human rights concerns
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia has bought 1000's of missiles and bombs in recent years and more contracts for arms have been approved. British made weapons may now be in use in the conflict in Yemen. Saudi is on the list of countries the British Foreign office thinks are of human rights concern.

attributes.action: Fund care homes exclusively for vegetarians and vegans.
attributes.background: Vegetarians, mainly Hindus have strict vegetarian dietary needs which are not available in any care home facilities provided by the Government.
attributes.additional_details:
Our research has shown there is not a single care home manged by the Government that funds catering for the needs of Hindu Vegetarians.

Private care homes are beyond the reach of 90% of the Hindus hence it is a moral obligation on the part of the Government to cater for the needs of the Hindu Community and other Vegetarians. 

The National Congress of Gujarati Organisations UK, the largest Hindu Organisation in the UK with 860,000 plus members, has requested this petition.
attributes.creator_name: Chandrakant J ivraj Rabheru President of NCGO

attributes.action: Strengthen laws to prosecute individuals who make false allegations of abuse
attributes.background: This petition calls for a Parliamentary debate to review whether current laws relating to the offences of perjury and perverting the course of justice are fit for purpose and that they are being pursued with vigour by the Crown Prosecution Service in cases of false allegations of abuse.
attributes.additional_details: False allegations of sexual and other types of abuse have a catastrophic effect upon the lives of those who are accused. Furthermore, making such allegations, whether motivated by a desire for vengeance, attention or compensation, also casts doubt on genuine complaints of abuse and undermines public confidence in our justice system. A review mechanism whereby compensation awarded to false accusers can be recovered (where convictions are later quashed by the Court of Appeal or the Supreme Court) should exist.

attributes.action: Intervene with executions of Ali Al-Nimr, Dawood Al-Marhoon, Abdullah Al-Zaher
attributes.background: Ali, Dawood, and Abdullah are young men who took a courageous stand for the oppressed religious minority groups in the country by partaking in peaceful protests. They were arrested as children in 2012 and have spent more than 1500 days in prison – mostly in solitary confinement.
attributes.additional_details: Saudi Arabia has a long history of human rights abuses. The Mabahith secret police agency detains political opponents, tortures, and interrogates them. This agency acts with impunity, and has affiliated prisons in which it keeps political dissidents in. The Islamic Human Rights Commission estimates 30,000 people have been kept in these prisons.

attributes.action: Allow safe spaces for rough sleepers to camp
attributes.background: I have worked with homeless people who have been badly treated and ended up in dangerous situations sleeping on the streets. None asked to end up in this situation. Nobody asked to be beaten or spat at or to become ill due to the freezing temperatures. Safe camp sites to help temporarily.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics are rising and people are becoming even more vulnerable. Safe camp sites will allow people to commune to support each other, protect each other and have minor shelter from a tent. If this was legal there would be less crisis on the streets as support agencies will be able to access a larger volume of people and the vulnerable can get the help they require. This could also improve many social factors. Those with no homes should not be punished for looking for somewhere safe to sleep!!

attributes.action: Give a 5 year minimum jail term if convicted of setting up/attending dog fights
attributes.background: A violent and savage example of man manipulating nature to fulfil his own curious bloodlust, dog fighting is rightly banned nearly everywhere in the world. Dog fighting has far from disappeared, in fact it’s a hobby that is distressingly alive and well and appears to be on the increase!
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs forced into fighting suffer terrible injuries, both from the fights and at the hands of their vicious owners. Death, blood and violence is a par for the course in the dog fighting world, compassion or conscience for the ‘losing’ dog is not an issue the average dog-fighter will concern themselves with.

In order to offer a sufficient deterrent I ask that those convicted of arranging/attending dog fights are to be given a mandatory custodial sentence of a minimum 5 years.

attributes.action: Stop all payments to Europe from the U.K.
attributes.background: To stop sending money to Eu now

attributes.action: Temporarily suspend the powers of devolution to Scotland.
attributes.background: The Scottish Government under the SNP have consistently failed to govern Scotland efficiently and effectively. Suspending devolution will allow a return to sensible and appropriate governance until such a time as a more accountable system, with suitable checks, can be established.
attributes.additional_details: Nearly every aspect of everyday life in Scotland is on the brink of disaster, from infrastructure maintenance through to the functioning of social services, health and education. Many farmers are near bankruptcy. Teachers have faced too much change without sufficient guidance, and standards in some areas have plummeted. The health service is in crisis with wards closing, waiting lists lengthening, insufficient doctors, nurses and cleaners and GP practices faltering under increased pressure.

attributes.action: Hold a British Referendum on the UK's Foreign Aid Budget Contributions.
attributes.background: The British Foreign Aid Budget is currently 0.7pc of GDP. Give the British people a chance to decide how much of our money goes to other Countries for 'Aid'. This current Government are cutting our public services and increasing taxation when there is clearly more money to be found in other budgets.

attributes.action: Get the baby's heel prick done within 24 hours of birth
attributes.background: The baby's heel prick is usually done between 5-7 days old. Sometimes this has been too late for conditions to be picked up on.
attributes.additional_details: I lost my little boy, Oliver-Rhys at 6 days old from MCADD which would have been picked up on in the heel prick, and we would have been able to save him. I have since had a little girl, Fjola-Rose since my loss and she was tested within 24 hours, it came back she did have MCADD too but we have been able to manage hers due to knowing. This shows that the test can be done this early. I want to change the dates so that less families have to go through the horrible ordeal.

attributes.action: Refunding toll charges in the event of long traffic delays
attributes.background: The purpose of this petition is to request a provision for refund and / or compensation to the drivers on the toll charges who loose time and money due to long traffic delays whilst crossing the toll operated roads, bridges or tunnels on regular basis. Journey's take 5 times longer in long delays.
attributes.additional_details:
Accidents, incidents, maintenance works, weather conditions etc. - lost working time, disruption to family life, and increased stress levels.

Toll charges contribute towards improving the quality of driving and reduce delays. When this fails it would be fair that the operators refund the toll charges during the event of traffic delays.

Rail commuters are entitled for a refund on their season tickets. Similar performance indicator must be operated to toll roads.

attributes.action: Prevent & Prohibit "Fellatio Cafes" from being established in London & the UK
attributes.background: This Petition asks the UK Government to establish the necessary steps to Prevent & Prohibit "Fellatio Cafes" from being established in the UK. There are plans for "Fellatio Cafes" to open in London & across the UK, serving coffee & food, customers will choose an escort to perform oral sex on them.
attributes.additional_details:
Bradley Charvet, the founder insists "everything related to the (Fellatio Cafe) is legal", But UK Law states "running a brothel" is illegal. What else is this cafe then? Mr Charvet said the cafe would "offer oral sex", there is no difference between oral sex or any other form of sex, he is seeking a legal loop-hole to establish his version of a brothel. The Government must stop this!

http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/london-to-get-coffee-and-fellatio-cafe-a7170266.html

attributes.action: Include cats on the reportable accident list like dogs and larger animals.
attributes.background: In less than 2 years I have had 3 cats killed after being hit by cars.  All 3 of my cats have just been left either in the road or at the side of the road and nobody has had the decency to let me know. I think it is about time that accidents involving cats should be reported as is the law with dogs.
attributes.additional_details: By letting the owner know that their beloved pet has been hit could be the difference between the cat surviving or passing away, those few minutes after an accident are crucial and could give the pet owner time to get to the vets and potentially save the cats life! I know this will not bring my cats back and it wont prevent more accidents.  But it would mean not so many people lose their pets if they can get them to the vets in time.

attributes.action: Don't allow train companies to increase fares until they improve their service
attributes.background:
Set up an independent website where unhappy customers can log their journey disruptions easily. Train companies can't skew the figures and true results can be recorded.

If service is not kept to a high standard with trains running on time, then they are not permitted to raise their prices.
attributes.additional_details:
Train companies have announced price hikes yet again across the board. Service is worse than ever, but prices are rising. The Delay Repay scheme is nothing short of a joke.

My train was running so late that they terminated it halfway, throw all of us off so they could skip the rest of the stops and arrive on time.  That is a clear case of skewing their own statistics of how many trains arrive 'on time' - with no care for the disruption they cause their own customers.

attributes.action: Remove VAT (20%) on AEDs (Automated External Defibrillators)
attributes.background: Help us remove VAT on lifesaving defibrillators.  Did you know Scouts and Guides, Cubs and Brownies, Beavers and Rainbows all have to pay 20% VAT for this emergency life-saving equipment. It is wrong. These are the keenest young people to train and encourage with basic life support skills.
attributes.additional_details:
More defibrillators would be available if this ridiculous tax was removed. This will encourage more young people in their thousands to grow up as the next generation with life-saving skills and a keenness to help others.  Signing this petition could save a life!

Cheaper AEDs (No VAT)
= more AEDs in communities 
+ more young, prepared people to assist victims when a SCA has occurred 
= MORE LIVES BEING SAVED
…..Let’s make it happen

attributes.action: make babys able to be registered from 16 weeks & death certificates to be given
attributes.background:
I'm starting this petition to try make it so all babies can be registered from 16 weeks and death certificates can be given even if the baby never took a breath. 
Please help me to make this happen, it would mean so much to so many people who have been in the same situation as myself. Thank you.
attributes.additional_details: I lost one of my twin girls to TTTS at 19 weeks and although I will never forget my girl, she will never be truly recognised as a baby by law because she died before 24 weeks. It hurts me daily knowing I will never have that certificate to prove her existence to her twin sister, I would do anything to be able to see my little girl recognised. Just 1 little piece of paper might seem like nothing but for someone who has lost their beautiful baby it could mean the world. 1 signature costs nothing.

attributes.action: Impose harsher sentences for deaths caused by driving offences
attributes.background: The justice system needs reviewing currently the sentences for driving offences particularly death caused by dangerous driving, careless driving and reckless driving are way too lenient. It gives no consideration to the emotional life long trauma and devastation to the victims families and friends.
attributes.additional_details: Multiple cases to support the leniency of the criminal justice in relation to driving offences - there are stricter sentences for assault, theft and non payment of council tax.  It seems that there is little value placed on human life which is utterly abhorrent.

attributes.action: Make sales of MOD land for development conditional to include Veterans housing
attributes.background:
The current shortage of housing stock is forcing many vulnerable and homeless Veterans into the private rental market which many cannot afford.
We want all future MOD land/building sales for development to be sold with condition that new houses include a % of social housing for Veterans in need.
attributes.additional_details: This would greatly alleviate the demands placed on the finances of local authorities, housing associations and charities which are having to pay to house vulnerable Veterans.

attributes.action: Government to immediately legislate that  visitors to UK  have Health Insurance
attributes.background: The NHS is a great institution, and unfortunately is now in dire straits. Health tourists  are taking advantage of a system that is not fit for purpose.  On arrival into the country  medical insurance must be provided with immediate effect.

attributes.action: Introduce longer fixed sentences for persistent serious offenders
attributes.background: Introduce longer fixed sentences for persistent serious offenders and tougher conditions and limits on their human rights whilst in prison
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was attacked by a persistent offender and very seriously injured.  She subsequently died as a result of her injuries and the psychological impact of the assault.  This offender will remain a risk to other people if he is ever released.

attributes.action: Introduce a Brain Aneurysm Awareness month to help save lives.
attributes.background: Approximately 1 in 50 people unknowingly have a brain aneurysm as most are only discovered if they rupture. This leads to an extremely dangerous condition known as a subarachnoid haemorrhage which can cause extensive brain damage. Help us raise awareness by signing. Know the facts, save a life!
attributes.additional_details:
NHS Facts
Approx 3 out of 5 people who suffer from a SAH die within 2 weeks. Half of those who survive are usually left with brain damage or disability.

http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Aneurysm/Pages/Introduction.aspx

attributes.action: For the court to issue a consecutive sentence and not concurrent.
attributes.background: If a civil servant is assaulted doing their duties and if the person is convicted in court they should get a consecutive sentence to any other convictions and not a concurrent sentence. If that person is serving a life sentence, when granted parole it is then added past their parole date.
attributes.additional_details: Having been assaulted myself where the perpetrator was given a concurrent sentence, where this left me feeling let down by the justice system. More recently a colleague was hit 4 times with a metal pole over his back while dealing with another incident and the perpetrator was given a 4 month concurrent sentence. This is during the zero tolerance to violence which the civil service champions, but when the prisoner is given a concurrent sentence it doesn't send the message of zero tolerance.

attributes.action: Make Strangles a Notifiable Disease
attributes.background: Strangles is a deadly and horrific disease in horses. Bacteria is spread through direct and indirect contact. It causes horses great distress and pain and is difficult to deal with. Outbreaks are currently managed by the common sense of horse owners but often still result in spread of the disease.
attributes.additional_details: It often happens that outbreaks are kept secret and advised biosecurity is not adhered to correctly. Horse Welfare is the biggest concern as containment procedures are optional, meaning that it often spreads and more horses suffer. The damage to the equine industry is great; entire show seasons lost, loss of livestock, and loss of income. Were it a notifiable disease anyone who had a case would not be able to keep it secret and they would have to put correct biosecurity measures in place by law.

attributes.action: Provide mental health support for all parents of premature and sick babies in UK
attributes.background:
90,253 premature and sick babies were admitted to a neonatal unit in the UK. [Neonatal Data Analysis Unit, 2014 report]
Parents of these babies are 10 times more likely to suffer post-natal depression.
41% of neonatal units have no access to trained support; 30% no support at all.
attributes.additional_details:
Little Miracles UK are campaigning to see: 

(1) Funding/resources for mental health support for all neonatal units in the UK 
(2) Mental health screening for all parents of premature and sick babies. 
(3) A trained mental health worker e.g. a counsellor, assigned to all neonatal units 
(4) After leaving hospital; care and professional support for as long as it is needed 
(5) Provision for peer-to-peer support, or similar, for these parents

attributes.action: Over-the-counter heartburn medication to warn, "see a GP if symptoms persist."
attributes.background: We call on Government to take steps to promote the earlier diagnosis of oesophageal cancer by requiring all packets of heartburn medication to carry an explicit warning of the importance of seeing a GP if symptoms persist for more than three weeks.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has the highest reported incidence in the world of oesophageal adenocarcinoma (OAC), a disease heavily associated with persistent and severe reflux and the precursor condition Barrett’s Oesophagus, that kills 7,700 people each year. Many people who develop OAC have been self-medicating on over-the-counter medication for years before their cancer diagnosis. Diagnosing, monitoring and treating Barrett’s Oesophagus is a key strategy for reducing the incidence of this cancer.

attributes.action: Give legal rights to Aunties and Uncles
attributes.background: Recently my niece was taken into care but there was nothing I could do to stop that from happening because I'm just an auntie. I tried to contact the Solicitors for legal aid, but because I was just an auntie, I was told I have no rights to appeal or apply for custody. I want this changed.

attributes.action: All cyclist road users must have insurance and a cycling licence to use the road
attributes.background: As a car owner I have had incidents at the fault of a cyclist.  Damage was caused to my vehicle but because cyclist are uninsured I was unable to call any authority to pay for the damages.  Cyclists can note our registration and go to the police at any time who can then contact our insurance
attributes.additional_details: I was indicating to turn right but waiting for oncoming traffic to give way.  Cyclist overtook on my drivers side knocking my wing mirror off, dent and scratched my door.  Asked why he done that, he answered "sorry my fault, I thought I could get around in time"!  I stayed with him made sure he was OK called the ambulance. A few weeks later I received a letter from Metropolitan Police regarding the incident! I had to pay for the damages to my car although it was not my fault!

attributes.action: For it to be standard, regular, practice to measure babies' heads.
attributes.background: Poppy's story! On August 25th Poppy's parents received the devastating news that she had water on the brain along with tumours. If Poppy's head had been measured they would have known it was the size of a 2 year old, having JUST turned one!
attributes.additional_details: Poppy's head was 6cm too big and had never been measured/recorded in her red book. Poppy is currently, with her parents, in HDU in Manchester Children's Hospital awaiting her fourth brain operation!

attributes.action: Accept more visas from Pakistan
attributes.background: People applying for Visa from Pakistan are being unfairly treated.  Figures obtained from UK Immigration & Visa office state that visa acceptance from Pakistan in 2015 was 46.9% & from India it was 89.2%.In 2016 up to September 30th the figure was 46.1% from Pakistan & 87% from India, highly unjust.

attributes.action: Increase maximum sentencing for animal cruelty from 6 months.
attributes.background: The maximum penalty is 6 months’ imprisonment and/or an unlimited fine. The financial element of the penalty was raised only last year from a maximum fine of £20,000.
attributes.additional_details: For this to be discussed in parliament there must be 100 000 signatures. I recently signed the same petition but it only got to 50 000.

attributes.action: Amnesty from prosecution and questioning of British Forces Veterans
attributes.background: The questioning and subsequent charging of ex service personnel, needs to stop. These serviceman and women served their country in good faith under orders and within the 'rules of engagement'. We, ex and current service personnel won't stand by and watch good men and women hanged out to dry.
